interests.name: Swayambhunath
interests.description: Swayambhunath is an ancient religious architecture atop a hill in the Kathmandu Valley, west of Kathmandu city. The Tibetan name for the site means 'Sublime Trees', for the many varieties of trees found on the hill.

interests.name: Ahsan Manzil
interests.description: Ahsan Manzil was the official residential palace and seat of the Nawab of Dhaka. The building is situated at Kumartoli along the banks of the Buriganga River in Dhaka, Bangladesh.

interests.name: Gateway Of India Mumbai
interests.description: The Gateway of India is an arch monument built during the 20th century in Mumbai, India. The monument was erected to commemorate the landing of King-EmperorGeorge V and Queen-Empress Mary at Apollo Bunder on their visit to India in 1911.
